business.headline: MTNL misses Rs 8,585 crore payments, owes 7 public sector banksIn a filing on Tuesday, MTNL confirmed that it has defaulted on both principal and interest payments to a group of lenders, which include some of India's biggest state-owned banks.
Sensex ends 317 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; HCLTech down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 317.45 points to end at 82,570.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 113.50 points to close at 25,195.80.

Anthem Biosciences IPO fully booked: Should you subscribe? Check listing gainsThe IPO opened for subscription on July 14, aims to raise Rs 3,395 crore through a complete offer for sale (OFS) of 5.96 crore equity shares.

Why Rs 12 crore didn't make this man happy? Investment advisor explainsWhile money matters, it should never cost you your health, peace of mind, or precious family time. True wealth is living well, not just stacking numbers in a bank account, says an investment advisor.

Why Zerodha's Nithin Kamath wants short selling made easy in IndiaIf someone wants to short a stock today, they mostly do it through futures or options. But there's a catch, there are only 224 stocks in India that have futures and options. So if a bad company is not on that list, no one can short it easily.

Theobroma to be sold, Rs 2,410-crore sweet deal baked by ChrysCapital: ReportFounded in 2004 by sisters Kainaz Messman Harchandrai and Tina Messman Wykes, Theobroma began with a single outlet at Cusrow Baug on Mumbai's Colaba Causeway.

Claiming fake ITR refunds? Here's what could happenTo give honest taxpayers a chance to fix their mistakes, the department had earlier asked people to revise their returns if they had claimed any wrong deductions.

Filing ITR-2 or ITR-3? Check these common mistakes and tips to avoid themUsing the Excel utility for ITR-2 or ITR-3 seems easy, but it's easy to get stuck if you're not careful. One wrong entry can throw your entire tax calculation off. Here's a handy guide to avoid common slip-ups.

Explained: Why HCLTech shares are down 4% todayOver the past few days, HCLTech has been under pressure. The stock has declined 7.9% in the last five trading sessions, 9.58% in the past month, and over 14.6% in the past six months.

Tesla showroom now in Mumbai. Price list of Model Y EVs in India revealed Live UpdatesThe Mumbai showroom will serve as Tesla's main display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.
Sensex opens 119 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Tata Motors up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 176.33 points to 82,429.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.50 points to 25,145.80 as of 9:29 am.

Tesla's Model Y to debut in India at Rs 60 lakhIn comparison, the Model Y starts at $44,990 in the United States, 263,500 yuan in China, and 45,970 euros in Germany. This makes the Indian version one of the most expensive, mainly due to import duties and logistics costs.

entertainment.headline: Aap Jaisa Koi exposes patriarchy of permission because who are you to allow me?In that one question, 'Aap Jaisa Koi' cuts through the soft-spoken patriarchy that hides behind smiles, affection, and so-called respect.

AP Dhillon and Tara Sutaria set to collaborate for Thodi Si Daaru song. Watch teaserPunjabi singer AP Dhillon and actor Tara Sutaria will be seen in the upcoming song 'Thodi Si Daaru'. Fans expressed excitement on the song's teaser, which was released on social media on Tuesday.

Vikrant Massey exits Don 3, makers begin search for new villain: ReportActor Vikrant Massey has reportedly exited the much-anticipated film 'Don 3.' He was playing the role of an antagonist. Aditya Roy Kapur and Vijay Deverakonda are likely in talks with the makers for replacement.

Announcement of Jr NTR–Trivikram film to be bigger than Ramayana: ProducerAs fans await updates on Jr NTR and Trivikram's mythological film, producer Naga Vamsi reveals that the announcement is being planned on a scale grander than the recently unveiled 'Ramayana' glimpse.

Panchayat's Aasif Khan suffers heart attack, shares hospital picActor Aasif Khan suffered a heart attack and was admitted to Kokilaben Hospital Mumbai. The actor shared a heartfelt message on social media after his recovery.

Arijit Singh turns director, to direct pan-India jungle adventure filmSinger Arijit Singh will be directing a jungle adventure film. The casting and pre-production work for the pan-Indian film is underway. Singh has also written the film.

Unreleased Beyonce songs stolen from car during Atlanta Cowboy Carter tourPop star Beyonce's unreleased music was stolen from her choreographer and dancer's car. The incident happened 48 hours before her Atlanta concert.

Cinematographer Senthil Kumar on exit from SSMB29: It was Rajamouli's callCinematographer KK Senthil Kumar confirms he's not part of SS Rajamouli's next with Mahesh Babu, adding that it was Rajamouli's decision to work with a different technician for the highly anticipated pan-India film.

Lokesh Kanagaraj confirms he's getting Rs 50 crore to direct Rajinikanth's Coolie'Coolie' director Lokesh Kanagaraj, during an interview, spoke about his remuneration for directing the Rajinikanth-starrer and how the box office success of his previous film boosted his salary.

Shweta Tripathi to produce her first queer romance film with Tillotama ShomeShweta Tripathi is making her debut as a film producer with the queer love story 'Mujhe Jaan Na Kaho Meri Jaan', co-starring Tillotama Shome. The film, directed by Sanjoy Nag, will go on floors by the end of 2025.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui shares daughter Shora's acting video, fans call her future starNawazuddin Siddiqui shared a video of his 15-year-old daughter, Shora, showcasing her acting skills. The video quickly went viral and earned praise from fans.

Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy launches Shrimad Bhagavatam film projectChief Minister of Telangana, Revanth Reddy, launched the ambitious 'Shrimad Bhagavatam Part-1' at Ramoji Film City, Hyderabad. He congratulated the creative team for coming up with the idea and wished for the project to be just as popular as the 'Ramayan' series.

BLACKPINK's JUMP tops Sabrina Carpenter's Manchild as biggest 2025 debutBLACKPINK's 'JUMP' shatters Spotify records with over 9.3 million streams. The track marks the biggest debut by a female artiste and K-pop group in 2025.

Who is Rahul Fazilpuria, the Haryanvi rapper who escaped a gun attack in Gurugram?Singer-rapper Rahul Fazilpuria was attacked and escaped after two gunshots were fired at his car. The incident happened in Gurugram, and the attackers have not yet been identified.

Shanaya Kapoor on first film getting shelved: Was my biggest love and heartbreakActor Shanaya Kapoor opens up on her first film getting shelved, calling it her biggest heartbreak. She shares how her parents' guidance helped her grow and succeed in Bollywood.

Heer Express trailer: Ashutosh Rana mentors a young chef in wholesome entertainerThe trailer for Umesh Shukla's 'Heer Express' released on Tuesday, July 15. The upcoming film marks the acting debut of Divita Juneja.

Legendary South actor B Saroja Devi's eyes donated as per her wishesLegendary South Indian actor B Saroja Devi's eyes were donated after her death. The 87-year-old died due to age-related ailments, and her corneas will soon be transplanted.

FIR against director Pa Ranjith and others in stuntman Raju's death caseA case has been filed against director Pa Ranjith and others after stuntman Mohan Raj died on the set of 'Vettuvam'. The incident raises questions about safety and legal accountability in film production.

Archana Puran Singh goes house-hunting in Dubai, says she'd have to buy a helicopterActor Archana Puran Singh recently explored several residential properties in Dubai. She shared a video of her house-hunting experience with her family on YouTube. She was accompanied by her husband Parmeet Sethi and her sons.

general news.headline: Welcome home, Shux! Indian astronaut returns after record-setting space missionHis participation in this largely commercial and internationally collaborative mission is regarded as a major leap forward in India's human spaceflight journey and a stepping stone to the country's upcoming Gaganyaan mission.
Centre says no warning labels on samosa, jalebi; only boards with adviceThe Union Health Ministry clarified that there won't be any warning labels on Indian snacks like samosa and jalebis.

He's running a full-blown circus: Rahul Gandhi slams S Jaishankar after Xi meetThe Congress took aim at S Jaishankar over his meeting with Xi Jinping, pointing out how China provided iron-clad support to Pakistan during Operation Sindoor.

Head shaved, tortured for dowry: Kerala woman in UAE kills baby, dies by suicideFollowing the death of a woman and her infant daughter in Sharjah, police in Kollam, Kerala, have registered a case against her husband, and his father and sister. The FIR, based on the complaint by the woman's mother, alleges domestic abuse and dowry harassment.

Classrooms without backbenchers: With new sitting format, schools stand outSchools in Kerala, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, and Punjab have begun removing the concept of backbenchers by rearranging classrooms into U, or semicircular, seating. The shift was inspired by a scene in a Malayalam movie, Sthanarthi Sreekuttan, where a student suggests equal seating for better inclusion.

Kerala nurse Nimisha Priya's execution, set for tomorrow, postponed: SourcesYemeni authorities have postponed the execution of 36-year-old Kerala nurse Nimisha Priya, which was scheduled for tomorrow. She was sentenced to death in 2020 for the murder of a Yemeni national.

Why Trump is withholding Epstein files he promised to releaseUS President Donald Trump promised to release the Epstein files during his campaign. It is reported that papers related to financier and child sex offender Jeffrey Epstein would nail the high and mighty in the US. Tesla boss Elon Musk attacked Trump for reneging on his promise. So why exactly isn't Trump releasing the Epstein files?
How India should leverage Dalai Lama factor with ChinaTibet is a sensitive issue in relations with China, but pandering to Beijing's demands is not the answer

Unfortunate: When King Charles reacted to Mohammed Siraj's Lord's Test dismissalIndia captain Shubman Gill and vice-captain Rishabh Pant met King Charles III on Tuesday. The King praised India's spirited fight and spoke about Mohammed Siraj's dismissal in the Lord's Test.

You're not chhapri, why are you hurt? Court to Hindustani Bhau over Farah Khan pleaPopular YouTuber Hindustani Bhau sought the registration of an FIR against Farah Khan over her remarks calling Holi a 'festival of chhapris'.

Can you hit Moscow? Trump urges Zelensky to strike deep inside RussiaDonald Trump has asked Ukrainian President Zelenskyy if Kyiv could hit Moscow with US-supplied long-range missiles. The query came during a July 4 call, just a day after Trump spoke to Russian President Putin.

Physics, Biology lecturers call student to friend's home in Bengaluru, gangrape herThree men, including two private college lecturers, were arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly raping a student multiple times. The case came to light after the victim approached the State Women's Commission.

Aap Jaisa Koi exposes patriarchy of permission because who are you to allow me?In that one question, 'Aap Jaisa Koi' cuts through the soft-spoken patriarchy that hides behind smiles, affection, and so-called respect.

Kerala Chief Minister says Nimisha Priya's execution delay 'comforting, hopeful'Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan expressed relief over the postponement of Nimisha Priya's execution in Yemen, praising humanitarian efforts led by Kanthapuram Aboobacker Musliyar and the Action Council.

No doubt we'll cope with new sanctions: Russia after Trump threatens tariffsThe remarks by Russia's Foreign Minister come after Trump threatened to impose "secondary tariffs" on Russia if Moscow failed to reach a ceasefire deal with Ukraine.

Panchayat's Aasif Khan suffers heart attack, shares hospital picActor Aasif Khan suffered a heart attack and was admitted to Kokilaben Hospital Mumbai. The actor shared a heartfelt message on social media after his recovery.

Tesla Model Y vs Kia EV6 vs Hyundai Ioniq 5 vs BYD Sealion 7 comparedTesla has launched the Model Y in India, entering a competitive premium EV segment alongside rivals like the Kia EV6, Hyundai Ioniq 5, and BYD Sealion 7. Here's how they compare.

Tesla's India debut, Model Y takes centrestage as Mumbai showroom opensAmerican EV maker Tesla has opened its first showroom in India in Mumbai, and listed official pricing for two variants that are to be made available in India.

Non-veg milk a red line in India-US trade talks. Here's whyAmid the India-US trade deal talks, Washington DC wants New Delhi to open its dairy market. But India insists on strict certification that ensures imported milk comes from cows not fed animal-based products like meat or blood. Rooted in religious and cultural sensitivities, India sees this as the "non-negotiable red line".

2015 notification: UK regulator clarifies notice on Boeing fuel switchesThe development comes in the backdrop of a preliminary report into the Air India crash in Ahmedabad flagging issues with the fuel control switches on the Boeing 787 aircraft.

Vikrant Massey exits Don 3, makers begin search for new villain: ReportActor Vikrant Massey has reportedly exited the much-anticipated film 'Don 3.' He was playing the role of an antagonist. Aditya Roy Kapur and Vijay Deverakonda are likely in talks with the makers for replacement.

FIR against director Pa Ranjith and others in stuntman Raju's death caseA case has been filed against director Pa Ranjith and others after stuntman Mohan Raj died on the set of 'Vettuvam'. The incident raises questions about safety and legal accountability in film production.

Pakistan to ban Shias from travelling solo to IraqPakistan is set to bar solo travel by Shia pilgrims to Iraq, starting January 1, 2026, in an effort to curb visa overstays and illegal migration. The move comes after repeated concerns from Iraq, Iran, and other host countries, where Pakistani nationals have entered on valid visas but overstayed and engaged in illegal commercial activities.

Boy's ball hunt leads to skeleton in locked house, death occurred 5 years agoA human skeleton was found inside a locked house near Nampally Market in Hyderabad. Police believe the death occurred at least four-five years ago and remained undetected for all these years.

sports.headline: Watch: Indian cricket teams meet King Charles III in London day after Lord's TestKing Charles II met the Indian men's and women's teams at St James's Palace in London on Tuesday. The men's team lost the Lord's Test by 22 runs, while the women's team will take part in a three-match ODI series following their 3-2 triumph in the ODI series.

Unfortunate: When King Charles reacted to Mohammed Siraj's Lord's Test dismissalIndia captain Shubman Gill and vice-captain Rishabh Pant met King Charles III on Tuesday. The King praised India's spirited fight and spoke about Mohammed Siraj's dismissal in the Lord's Test.

India to face England, New Zealand in Women's World Cup warm-upsIndia are set to lock horns with England and New Zealand in their two warm-up matches of the Women's ODI World Cup on September 25 and 27 in Bengaluru.

Jofra Archer dons commentator's hat after proving critics wrong at Lord'sJofra Archer made his Test return in style—and with a smile—by wearing Jonathan Agnew's blue hat on-air, cheekily completing a bet made years ago that he'd never play red-ball cricket again.

Henderson returns to Premier League with Brentford after Ajax exitFormer Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson makes his return to the Premier League as he joins Brentford on a two-year deal. After a brief stint outside Engalnd, the Premier League and Champions League winner makes his return to English top-flight.

Ben Stokes doesn't need Ashes for greatest England captain tag: VaughanMichael Vaughan called Ben Stokes one of England's finest Test captains. He emphasised Stokes doesn't need an Ashes win to prove his greatness as a captain.

Liam Dawson returns to Tests after 8 years, replaces Shoaib BashirENG vs IND: Liam Dawson has replaced the injured Shoaib Bashir for the Manchester Test, scheduled to begin on July 23. On Monday, England took a 2-1 series lead after beating India by 22 runs.

All-round Suryavanshi takes spotlight, Vaughan takes three in Youth TestIndia U19's Vaibhav Suryavanshi was back amongst the runs as he smashed a quickfire fifty while England U19's Archie Vaughan was the pick of the bowlers with three wickets on Day 3 of the Youth Test in Beckenham.

ICC Women's T20I rankings: Shafali Verma returns to top 10 after England heroicsIndia opener Shafali Verma has returned to the top 10 in the ICC Women's T20I Batting Rankings, as per the latest update released on Tuesday. Shafali was the second-highest run-getter behind fellow opener Smriti Mandhana.

Fast bowler James Anderson bags major T20 league contract at 42James Anderson has been selected by Manchester Originals as a wildcard for The Hundred 2025 season. Anderson retired from Test cricket, but the 42-year-old has been playing domestic cricket.

Great for Test cricket: Jonathan Trott praises Lord's red-ball classicEngland vs India: Former England batsman Jonathan Trott has hailed the thrilling third Test in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, saying it was great for red-ball cricket.

Liam Dawson returns to Tests after 8 years, replaces Shoaib BashirENG vs IND: Liam Dawson has replaced the injured Shoaib Bashir for the Manchester Test, scheduled to begin on July 23. On Monday, England took a 2-1 series lead after beating India by 22 runs.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
